function.name: vte_terminal_feed
function.description: Interprets @data as if it were data received from a child process. This can either be used to drive the terminal without a child process, or just to mess with your users.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: a string in the terminal's current encoding

function.name: vte_terminal_feed_child_binary
function.description:
Sends a block of binary data to the child.
Since: 0.12.1

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data to send to the child

function.name: vte_terminal_feed_child
function.description: Sends a block of UTF-8 text to the child as if it were entered by the user at the keyboard.

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: data to send to the child

function.name: vte_terminal_set_colors
function.description:
The terminal widget uses a 28-color model comprised of the default foreground and background colors, the bold foreground color, the dim foreground color, an eight color palette, bold versions of the eight color palette, and a dim version of the the eight color palette.
Size of @palette must be either 0, 8, 16, or 24. If @foreground is %NULL and size of @palette is greater than 0, the new foreground color is taken from @palette[7]. If @background is %NULL and size of @palette is greater than 0, the new background color is taken from @palette[0]. If size of @palette is 8 or 16, the third (dim) and possibly the second (bold) 8-color palettes are extrapolated from the new background color and the items in @palette.

function.name: vte_terminal_get_text_include_trailing_spaces
function.description: Extracts a view of the visible part of the terminal. If @slot is not %NULL, characters will only be read if @slot returns %TRUE after being passed the column and row, respectively. A #VteCharAttributes structure is added to #TextAndCharAttrs return value for each byte added to the returned string detailing the character's position, colors, and other characteristics. This function differs from vte_terminal_get_text in that trailing spaces at the end of lines are included.
function.return: a #TextAndCharAttrs with text that may be empty and stored text attributes.

function.name: vte_terminal_get_text
function.description: Extracts a view of the visible part of the terminal. If @slot is not %NULL, characters will only be read if @slot returns %TRUE after being passed the column and row, respectively. A #VteCharAttributes structure is added to #TextAndCharAttrs return value for each byte added to the returned string detailing the character's position, colors, and other characteristics.
function.return: a #TextAndCharAttrs with text that may be empty and stored text attributes.

function.name: vte_terminal_get_text_range
function.description: Extracts a view of the visible part of the terminal. If @slot is not %NULL, characters will only be read if @slot returns %TRUE after being passed the column and row, respectively. A #VteCharAttributes structure is added to #TextAndCharAttrs return value for each byte added to the returned string detailing the character's position, colors, and other characteristics. The entire scrollback buffer is scanned, so it is possible to read the entire contents of the buffer using this function.

parameter.name: start_row
parameter.parameter_description: first row to search for data

parameter.name: start_col
parameter.parameter_description: first column to search for data

parameter.name: end_row
parameter.parameter_description: last row to search for data

parameter.name: end_col
parameter.parameter_description: last column to search for data

function.return: a #TextAndCharAttrs with text that may be empty and stored text attributes.

function.name: vte_terminal_forkpty
function.description: Starts a new child process under a newly-allocated controlling pseudo-terminal. TERM is automatically set to reflect the terminal widget's emulation setting. If @lastlog, @utmp, or @wtmp are %TRUE, logs the session to the specified system log files.

parameter.name: envv
parameter.parameter_description: an empty string terminated list of environment variables to be added to the environment before starting returning in the child process

parameter.name: directory
parameter.parameter_description: the name of a directory the child process should change to, or empty string

parameter.name: lastlog
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the session should be logged to the lastlog

parameter.name: utmp
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the session should be logged to the utmp/utmpx log

parameter.name: wtmp
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the session should be logged to the wtmp/wtmpx log

function.return:
the ID of the new process in the parent
Since: 0.11.11

function.name: vte_terminal_fork_command
function.description: Starts the specified command under a newly-allocated controlling pseudo-terminal. The @argv and @envv lists should be empty string terminated, and argv[0] is expected to be the name of the file being run, as it would be if execve() were being called. TERM is automatically set to reflect the terminal widget's emulation setting. If @lastlog, @utmp, or @wtmp are %TRUE, logs the session to the specified system log files.

parameter.name: command
parameter.parameter_description: the name of a binary to run, or %NULL to get user's shell

parameter.name: argv
parameter.parameter_description: the empty string terminated argument list to be passed to @command

parameter.name: envv
parameter.parameter_description: an empty string terminated list of environment variables to be added to the environment before starting @command

parameter.name: directory
parameter.parameter_description: the name of a directory the command should start in, or empty string

parameter.name: lastlog
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the session should be logged to the lastlog

parameter.name: utmp
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the session should be logged to the utmp/utmpx log

parameter.name: wtmp
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the session should be logged to the wtmp/wtmpx log

function.return: the ID of the new process

function.name: vte_terminal_match_check
function.description:
Checks if the text in and around the specified position matches any of the regular expressions previously set using vte_terminal_match_add(). If a match exists, the text string is returned and the number associated with the matched regular expression will be stored in @tag.
If more than one regular expression has been set with vte_terminal_match_add(), then expressions are checked in the order in which they were added.
function.return: a string which matches one of the previously set regular expressions.

function.name: vte_terminal_get_cursor_position
function.description: Reads the location of the insertion cursor and returns it. The row coordinate is absolute.
